### Lung Tx

French Biopsy series of 100 patients [KI Reports 2024](https://www.kireports.org/article/S2468-0249(24)01821-7/fulltext)

-   **Main Biopsy Indication**: Chronic renal dysfunction in 72% of patients.
-   **Timing**: Biopsies occurred at a median of 26.3 months post-transplantation and 15 months after signs of renal impairment.
-   **Frequent Findings**: Arteriosclerosis, acute calcineurin inhibitor toxicity, thrombotic microangiopathy (TMA), and acute tubular necrosis.
-   **TMA Correlation**: Strongly associated with combined mTOR inhibitors and calcineurin inhibitors.
-   **ESRD Risk Factors**: Postoperative dialysis, proteinuria \>3 g/g, and glomerulosclerosis \>4%.
-   **ESRD Outcome**: 34 patients progressed to ESRD approximately 20.1 months after biopsyâ€‹
